thread.title: Cumbria Constabulary to take legal action over proposed cuts | Border
thread.title_full: Cumbria Constabulary to take legal action over proposed cuts | Border - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Cumbria Constabulary to take legal action over proposed cuts | Border
text:
Cumbria Police Credit: PA Cumbria Police says it is taking legal action over the budget cuts it's facing.
The Chief Constable fears the force could have to save an additional £26m pounds by 2020.
This morning the force confirmed it is one of 13 forces taking legal action against the government.
It comes as an independent police watchdog rated the Cumbria Police as "good" adding that it is well prepared to face funding challenges.
But Cumbria's Police and Crime Commissioner wants a judicial review about the process of changes to police funding.
As far as Cumbria is concerned the thing we have to do now is to make it quite clear to government ministers what the consequences of these decisions would be for the effective running of police services in this county.
– Richard Rhodes, Police & Crime Commissioner Last updated Tue 20 Oct 2015 Read more 8 updates Cumbria Police faces funding cuts of up to £26m Politics Cumbria
